item.title: Introduction
item.description: Design has always been a large part of our lives. Whatever product you make, you want it to be both beautiful and simple to use / understand.

item.title: What is Graphic Design?
item.description: Every design has the same starting point. No matter what you’re doing, you need to have a purpose for your design.

item.title: Point
item.description: The smallest possible visual element is a point. In the mathematical sense, a point indicates a precise location, but can’t be seen or felt.

item.title: Line
item.description: In a mathematical sense, a line is an infinite series of points next to each other. Where points had no area at all, lines have length, but no breadth.

item.title: Shape
item.description: What have we learned so far? A point was just any single thing, no area. A line has length, but no breadth.

item.title: Form
item.description: Stepping up our game, we add another dimension. Shapes had two dimensions: width and height. Now we arrive at the biggest elements with as much as three dimensions.
